lead_paragraph: A 22-year-old woman from the northern part of the country was identified as the victim, and certain areas would be quarantined in response to her death.

byline.contributor: Dionne Searcey reported from Dakar, and Sheri Fink from New York.
byline.original: By DIONNE SEARCEY and SHERI FINK

snippet: A 22-year-old woman from the northern part of the country was identified as the victim, and certain areas would be quarantined in response to her death.

headline.main: Day After a Victory Over Ebola, Sierra Leone Reports a Death
headline.print_headline: Ebola Case Is Reported in West Africa

abstract: World Health Organization confirms body of 22-year-old student in Sierra Leone tested positive for Ebola virus, same day WHO had announced all known transmission of Ebola in West Africa had been stopped.
